verses.text: 所以弟兄們，我憑著 神的仁慈勸你們，要把身體獻上，作聖潔而蒙 神悅納的活祭；這是你們理所當然的事奉（「理所當然的事奉」或譯「屬靈的敬拜」）。

words.note: Often used to address fellow believers.
The empty square indicates reverence for the divine name.
A core attribute of God and a state believers aspire to.
Often indicates receiving something good, or a passive construction.
The empty square indicates reverence for the divine name.
Describes something God finds pleasing.
A key theological concept in Christianity.
An idiom meaning 'right and proper by reason'.
Refers to religious service or ministry.

verses.text: 不要模仿這個世代，倒要藉著心意的更新而改變過來，使你們可以察驗出甚麼是 神的旨意，就是察驗出甚麼是美好的、蒙他悅納的和完全的事。

words.note: Often refers to the present worldly system or era.
Spiritual renewal, transformation of one's inner being.
To test and perceive spiritual truths or God's will.
The empty square indicates reverence for the divine name.
Refers to God's divine plan or desire.
To test and perceive spiritual truths or God's will.
Often indicates receiving something good, or a passive construction.
Describes something God finds pleasing.

verses.text: 我憑著所賜給我的恩典，對你們各人說，不可自視太高，高於所當看的，反而應該照著 神分給各人信心的大小，看得適中。

words.note: Used to form a noun phrase from a verb phrase.
Often used for gifts from a superior or deity.
Divine favor or unmerited blessing.
Used to form a noun phrase from a verb phrase.
The empty square indicates reverence for the divine name.
Trust or belief in God or a religious doctrine.

verses.heading: Conduct in Humility

verses.text: 就像一個身體有許多肢體，各肢體都有不同的功用；

words.note: Often used metaphorically for members of the church body.
Often used metaphorically for members of the church body.

verses.text: 照樣，我們大家在基督裡成為一個身體，也是互相作肢體。

words.note: A transliteration of 'Christos' (anointed one).
Often used metaphorically for members of the church body.

verses.text: 照著所賜給我們的恩典，我們各有不同的恩賜：說預言的，就應當照著信心的程度去說；

words.note: Indicates conformity or reliance.
Forms a nominal phrase with the following verb.
Often refers to divine giving.
Lit. 'gracious standard' or 'gift of grace'.
Lit. 'grace bestowed', a gift from God.
A verb-object compound, 'speak prophecy'.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun-like descriptor.
Lit. 'trusting heart'.
Indicates direction or purpose of the action.

verses.text: 服事人的，就應當照著恩賜去服事；教導的，就應當照著恩賜教導；
勸慰的，就應當照著恩賜勸慰；把財物分給人的要真誠；領導的要殷勤；行善的要樂意。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.
Often implies earnest and hard-working.
A verb-object compound, 'perform good'.

verses.text: 愛，不可虛偽；惡，要厭惡；善，要持守。

words.note: Implies guarding or maintaining something precious.

verses.heading: Conduct in Love

verses.text: 要以手足之愛彼此相親，用恭敬的心互相禮讓。

words.note: Lit. 'hands and feet', refers to close kinship.
Classical equivalent of '的'.

words.definition: love each other, be close to
words.note: Often used for family or close relationships.
Emphasizes humility and politeness.

verses.text: 殷勤不可懶惰，心靈要火熱，常常服事主；

words.note: Lit. 'fire-hot'.
Often used in religious contexts for serving God/others.

verses.text: 在盼望中要喜樂，在患難中要堅忍，禱告要恆切。

words.note: A verb-object compound: 禱 (to pray) + 告 (to tell/report).
Implies constancy and earnestness in prayer.

verses.text: 聖徒有缺乏的，就要接濟；客旅要熱誠地款待。

words.note: Here functions to mean 'those who lack'.
Transforms adjective into adverbial phrase.

verses.text: 迫害你們的，要為他們祝福；只可祝福，不可咒詛。

words.note: Here functions to mean 'those who persecute you'.

verses.text: 要與喜樂的人一同喜樂，與哀哭的人一同哀哭。

words.note: Forms 'those who are joyful'.
Forms 'those who are mourning'.

verses.text: 要彼此同心，不可心高氣傲，倒要俯就卑微的。不可自以為聰明。

words.definition: united in heart, of one mind
words.note: Lit. 'same heart'
An idiom (chengyu) meaning 'haughty in heart and spirit'.
Often implies humbling oneself to connect with others.
Common in biblical contexts describing humility or the poor.
Turns the preceding adjective into 'the humble ones'.
Often implies being conceited.

verses.text: 不可以惡報惡。大家以為美的事，要努力去作。

words.note: Indicates action/direction.

verses.text: 可能的話，總要盡你們的所能與人和睦。

words.note: Often used with '如果' or '可能' to mean 'if'.

words.definition: what one is able to do
words.note: Literally 'that which is able'.
Often used in religious or formal contexts for peace and concord.

verses.text: 親愛的啊，不要為自己伸冤，寧可等候主的忿怒，因為經上記著，主說：「伸冤在我，我必報應。」

words.note: Forms 'beloved ones' or 'dear ones'.
Common in biblical and legal contexts for seeking redress.
Refers to God or Jesus in Christian contexts.
Stronger than general anger, often divine.
Refers specifically to written holy texts.
Refers to God or Jesus in Christian contexts.
Common in biblical and legal contexts for seeking redress.
Here implies 'responsibility is with'.
Often implies divine retribution or consequences.

verses.text: 相反地，「如果你的仇敵餓了，就給他吃；如果渴了，就給他喝。因為你這樣作，就是把炭火堆在他的頭上。」

words.note: Common in biblical and military contexts.
Marks a direct object affected by the verb.
Refers to hot coals, often symbolic.

verses.text: 不可被惡所勝，反要以善勝惡。

words.note: Expresses prohibition.
Can also be an adjective 'wicked' or verb 'to hate'.
Often used with '被' in literary/formal/biblical contexts to form a passive voice.
Literary or formal equivalent of '用'.
Can also be an adjective 'good'.
